contextId.occurrenceNote: These two phrases mean the same thing. The idea is repeated for emphasis. Alternate translation: "very secretly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.quote: οὐ φανερῶς, ἀλλὰ ὡς ἐν κρυπτῷ

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is the use of two words with similar meanings to add emphasis. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])

John combines these phrases that have similar meanings to express the intense emotional distress and possible anger that Jesus experienced. Alternate translation: "he was greatly upset" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.quote: ἐνεβριμήσατο τῷ πνεύματι καὶ ἐτάραξεν ἑαυτόν
contextId.glQuote: he was deeply moved in his spirit and was troubled
